intro: Kyllinga erecta var. intercedens, commonly known as the upright spikerush, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its upright, grass-like stems and small, clustered spikelets that bear tiny flowers. It typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of water bodies. Its botanical structure supports its role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and stabilizing soil.
